page.title: 06Mr.Johnson's farm
page.content: { Mr.Johnson is a farmer}but he has not been a farmer all his life.When he was younger he was a professional footballer.If he was not a farmer he would be an R.A.F pilot. {He has 6000 hens and he grows 15 {tonnes of tomatoes a year and half a {million daffodils.He buys his hens for {Â£2.20 each.The tomatoes grow in {rockwool under glass.}A farm is not hard to run. He sells tomatoes and eggs in his own shops.He has lived in {Howden-le-Wear for thirteen {years.}Three people work for him,one full time and two part time.The workers are all under thirty.He has twenty acres of land.His greenhouse has stood for four years.{It costs {Â£2,500 a year}for the pellets to heat the greenhouse.He gets up at 3.30 each morning.He has two tractors and some trailers.
